hope this helps in someway

@Goddess wrote:

ok im doing something similar with my server…except its completely different. what i did was i found a source with the ::starter that you can only use once. and then i just added it to my code, and then altered it depending on the different codes…sorry if i confused you

and as for the second…ok this is just a theory but…theres a way…urgh…i think you have to find the interface of the spell in itself and add that to it. because like ok…thats just the part with the attacking youve added your thingy too. you also have to add it to the spell interface…or if some more experienced coder is laughing at me cause im wayyyyyyyyyyy wrong just correct me

item.source: Need some help with my own code

item.title: Need some help with my own code
item.dc:creator: @toonshorty toonshorty
item.description:
@toonshorty wrote:

Problem 1)

Ok,

I am writing my own code where you have to find the air, earth, water and fire obelisks to cast each spell from that element (e.g. you must find the air obelisk to cast any air spells)

But i need it to save it because when you logout it forgets that you found it so how do I make a new line in the character file lile “foundFire = value”

so i could have… if (foundFire = true) { ftruefalse = true; }

here are the booleans for the thing…

[code]boolean etruefalse = false;
boolean wtruefalse = false;
boolean ftruefalse = false;
boolean atruefalse = false;

public boolean fireAlt(boolean ftruefalse) {if (ftruefalse == true) { return true; } else { return false; }}

public boolean waterAlt(boolean wtruefalse) {if (wtruefalse == true) { return true; } else { return false; }}

public boolean earthAlt(boolean etruefalse) {if (etruefalse == true) { return true; } else { return false; }}

public boolean airAlt(boolean atruefalse) {if (atruefalse == true) { return true; } else { return false; }}
[/code]

its my first ever code that wasnt C+P so it may be a little wrong but it does work…

so I want to add that varible (“foundFire”) and foundWater etc… into the character file so it rememebers if you found them…

thanks,

~ toonshorty

Problem 2)

Also with the code above I edited the magic stuff…

if (magicID == 1152 && atruefalse == true) { // Wind Strike ProjectileSpell(90, 95, 92, absY, absX, offsetY, offsetX, npcIndex, EnemyY2, EnemyX2, 2, 1, 566, 558, 1, 1); } else { sendMessage("You must find the wind obelisk before casting this spell"); } if (magicID == 1154 && wtruefalse == true) { // Water Strike ProjectileSpell(93, 94, 95, absY, absX, offsetY, offsetX, npcIndex, EnemyY2, EnemyX2, 5, 1, 566, 558, 555, 1, 1, 1); } else { sendMessage("you must find the water obelisk before casting this spell"); } if (magicID == 1156 && etruefalse == true) { // Earth Strike ProjectileSpell(96, 97, 98, absY, absX, offsetY, offsetX, npcIndex, EnemyY2, EnemyX2, 9, 1, 566, 558, 557, 1, 1, 2); } else { sendMessage("You must find the earth obelisk before casting this spell"); } if (magicID == 1158 && ftruefalse = true) { // Fire Strike - now Shock Wave ProjectileSpell(448, 100, 481, absY, absX, offsetY, offsetX, npcIndex, EnemyY2, EnemyX2, 30, 1, 566, 558, 554, 1, 1, 3); stillgfx(453, EnemyY2, EnemyX2); attackNPCSWithin(453, 30, 4); attackPlayersWithin(453, 30, 4); hitDiff = 5 + misc.random(25); } else { sendMessage("You must find the fire obelisk before casting this spell"); }

(i have only edited the first 4 spells at the moment)

but even if you dont find the obelisk it still attacks without the magic atually casting and hits 0…

how do I make it so that it just says “You have not found the obelisk” and Won’t attack the NPC?

thanks,

~ toonshorty

Read full topic
